subject: Leadership
title: Balancing Profit and Principle
description: Learn Balancing Profit and Principle in one minute.

hook.text: The quarterly report says cut costs. Your values say treat people fairly. Which wins? That defines your leadership.

buildup.text: Short-term profit pressure is the top reason for ethical compromise. Quarterly thinking erodes long-term integrity.

discovery.text: Eccles' research: companies managing for the long term outperform short-term focused peers by 47% in stock returns.

twist.text: Ethical leaders sometimes lose the quarter and win the decade. The market punishes patience. History rewards it.

climax.text: Set boundaries around what you won't do for profit. Communicate them clearly. Let stakeholders choose knowingly.

punchline.text: Profit earned at the cost of principle is always borrowed time.

quiz.question: What is the main driver of ethical compromise in business?
options: Short-term profit pressure overriding long-term values
